channel.title: Pi Illegal start of expression

item.title: Pi Illegal start of expression
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Hey guys, I added this to my CastleWarObjects.java and got this error.

src\server\model\minigames\CastleWarObjects.java:205: illegal start of expressio n public void castleWarsFlags(Client c, int team) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWarObjects.java:205: illegal start of expressio n public void castleWarsFlags(Client c, int team) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWarObjects.java:205: ';' expected public void castleWarsFlags(Client c, int team) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWarObjects.java:205: <identifier> expected public void castleWarsFlags(Client c, int team) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWarObjects.java:205: not a statement public void castleWarsFlags(Client c, int team) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWarObjects.java:205: ';' expected public void castleWarsFlags(Client c, int team) { ^ 6 errors Press any key to continue . . .

I don’t get it though because I’m pretty sure it is a statement and I don’t need a ; anywhere, so what’s the problem, this is what it’s saying is wrong.

public void castleWarsFlags(Client c, int team) { if (team == 1) { if (CastleWars.SflagDropped) { c.getPA().object(4900, CastleWars.saraFlagX, CastleWars.saraFlagY, CastleWars.saraFlagZ, -3, 10); } else { c.getPA().object(-1, CastleWars.saraFlagX, CastleWars.saraFlagY, CastleWars.saraFlagZ, -3, 10); } if (CastleWars.SaraFlagTaken || CastleWars.SflagDropped) { c.getPA().object(4377, 2429, 3074, 3, -3, 10); } else { c.getPA().object(4902, 2429, 3074, 3, -3, 10); } } else if (team == 2) { if (CastleWars.ZflagDropped) { c.getPA().object(4901, CastleWars.zammyFlagX, CastleWars.zammyFlagY, CastleWars.zammyFlagZ, -1, 10); } else { c.getPA().object(-1, CastleWars.zammyFlagX, CastleWars.zammyFlagY, CastleWars.zammyFlagZ, -1, 10); } if (CastleWars.ZammyFlagTaken || CastleWars.ZflagDropped) { c.getPA().object(4378, 2370, 3133, 3, -1, 10); } else { c.getPA().object(4903, 2370, 3133, 3, -1, 10); } } }

Read full topic
